paper.title: Structure and importance of logspace-MOD-classes
paper.venue: Symposium on Theoretical Aspects of Computer Science
paper.abstract: We refine the techniques of Beigel, Gill, Hertrampf [BGH90] who investigated polynomial time counting classes, in order to make them applicable to the case of logarithmic space. We define the complexity classes MODkL and demonstrate their significance by proving that all standard problems of linear algebra over the finite rings Z/kZ are complete for these classes. We then define new complexity classes LogFew and LogFewNL and identify them as adequate logspace versions of Few and LogFew and FewP. We show that LogFew and LogFewNL is contained in MODZkL and that LogFew is contained in MODkL for all k. Also an upper bound for L #L in terms of computation of integer determinants is given from which we conclude that all logspace counting classes are contained in NC2.
